cameron says he wants to be known for rescuing the economy , and for providing economic security , for people at work and for people in retirement too .
a good government would be one that delivers economic security , and delivers national security , he says .
a great one would be one that tackles some of our deep-seated social problems , he says .
he says he is passionate about the health service .
that is why he wants it working on a full seven-day basis .
problems in the care system , in prisons , and with entrenched poverty need tackling .
we need better schools , and childcare , and we also need to address drug problems , he says .
here are some highlights from david cameron 's morning interviews so far .
on jeremy hunt 's comments about tax credits graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron says he read top line of hunt story and thought `` what 's going on here ?
`` , but read full quote and not as reported @ twitterid graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron : `` we are a hard-working country .
we are not missing a work ethic .
where we 're falling behind america is on productivity . ''
@ twitterid5live tax credits graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron defending tax credit cuts : `` people will earn more and keep more of their money .
they are fair changes . ''

@ twitterid5live on immigration norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) britian shd be proud that it is a multi national , multi ethnic democracy - david cameron jason farrell ( @ jasonfarrellsky ) cameron tells @ twitterid that he agrees with theresa may on immigration that `` the levels have been too high . ''

on his successor as prime minister asa bennett ( @ asabenn ) `` i am halfway through this job '' - david cameron tells @ twitterid , talking of doing `` two terms for 10 years '' graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) asked if he could be tempted to stay on , cameron says `` no , as i see it i 'm half-way through the job two terms , ten years . ''
@ twitterid graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron wo n't lay a bet on his successor as he 's not a gambler .
`` i did n't inherit the habit . ''
@ twitterid by his he meant his father , who did used to bet , he told sky .
on jeremy corbyn 's visit to manchester last night graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron on @ twitterid on corbyn rally in same city : `` it 's a free country .
i ca n't place restrictions . ''
on the school truancy changes ned simons ( @ nedsimons ) david cameron asked if his children have ever skipped school : no they have n't played truant . '
ned simons ( @ nedsimons ) i notice on @ twitterid the prime minister avoided answering whether he every played truant himself .
on sport graeme demianyk ( @ graemedemianyk ) cameron says his sporting `` curse '' is `` nonsense '' : `` who was the pm when we won the ashes ?
during the olym medal haul ? ''
@ twitterid
david cameron has just told radio 5 live that he thinks the government should continue with the tax credit cuts .
david cameron is just winding up an interview on lbc .
here is where he has been sitting .
norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) the pm doing an early morning turn on the wireless at # cpc15
david cameron is doing a round of interviews this morning from the conservative conference .
i have heard three already , and mostly they have been pretty dull , but two lines have emerged .
cameron has said that jeremy hunt was widely misquoted yesterday when he said that the tax credit cuts will help the british to learn how to work as hard as the chinese .
( hunt 's words are quoted in the guardian splash .
he is not claiming they have been inaccurately reported .
you can read them yourself and decide if they have been misinterpreted . )

nick sutton ( @ suttonnick ) tuesday 's guardian front page - hunt : welfare cuts encourage harder work # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers # cpc15 cameron has said he agrees with the claims theresa may is making in her speech today about immigration .
as the guardian reports , she will say that mass migration of the past decade is no longer sustainable and is threatening britain 's cohesion .
here is the agenda for the day .
8.10am : david cameron is interviewed on the today programme .
10.30am : session on home affairs and justice , with speeches from michael gove , the justice secretary , and theresa may , the home secretary .
11.50am : boris johnson , the mayor of london , speaks .
1pm : george osborne is interviewed by katharine viner , the guardian 's editor-in-chief , at a fringe event .

2.30pm : session on education , health and work and pensions , with speeches from nicky morgan , the education secretary , iain duncan smith , the work and pensions secretary , and jeremy hunt , the health secretary .
if you want to follow me or get in touch on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .

bulletin.text: May outlines tough new immigration measures.
